meanings.definition: A selection from the Prophets read in synagogue as part of the Jewish liturgy.
meanings.sent1: During the service, the rabbi read the haphtara aloud to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The haphtara is an important part of the synagogue ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as the haphtara was read, finding the words funny.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed through the synagogue as she read the haphtara with passion.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the haphtara stayed with the listeners long after the service ended.

meanings.definition: To read or chant a passage from the Prophets in synagogue.
meanings.sent1: The cantor will haphtara the selected passage during the service.
meanings.sent2: People take turns to haphtara the verses during the prayer service.
meanings.sent3: He decided to haphtara the passage in a deep, booming voice to make it more engaging.
meanings.sent4: She haphtaraed the ancient words as if they held the secrets of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The congregation listened intently as he haphtaraed the sacred text.
